itemizedlist.listitem: HTTP Server. Apache with mod_rewrite is a good choice.

sect1.title: Download
sect1.para: You can download Atomik from the Atomik website
You can create your own Atomik distribution online. It allows you to pack in only the plugins you want.

listitem.para: Upload or move Atomik files and folders into a directory available from the web.
Navigate to the url of the folder where you unpacked Atomik. Eg: http://localhost/atomik.
You should see a Congratulations, you're ready to roll! page.

sect1.title: More about the directory structure
sect1.para: Atomik's core file, namely index.php, must be situated at the root of your website. The default directory structure is simple because everything goes into this webroot.
Your application per se goes into the app directory. Actions and views have their own directories.
When using the provided Apache .htaccess file, the app directory is not accessible from the web.
You can put your assets (css, js, images) anywhere. I like to use an assets folder for this kind of things.
sect1.note: If you do not use the provided .htaccess file, do not forget to allow assets folders in plugins directories. Such a path can look like app/plugins/MyPlugin/assets.

note.para: In a production environment, it is always better to remove the application files from the webroot. This is not the default way of doing things with Atomik as it can be a bit more difficult. However it is very easy to configure. Atomik allows you to edit the path for each directory. This will be covered in the configuration chapter.
